<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>[August 5, 2011] <a href="http://demo.erlang.org">Erlang User Conference 2011</a></b></td></tr></table>
<p>
<table border=0>
 <tr>
  <td><img src="images/stadshuset-townhall2.jpg" border=0></td>
  <td> &nbsp; </td>
  <td>
<p>It is  with great pleasure that we announce the launch of the 2011 Erlang User  Conference in Stockholm.
The date for your diary is 3 November 2011.  Early Bird registration will open on 15 August so in the
meantime if you  wish to <a href="http://www.erlang-factory.com/conference/ErlangUserConference2011/submit_talk">submit a talk</a>,
we would love to hear from you.

<p>After  the success of last year's Conference and it selling out, you will want  to book your place early.
The Erlang User Conference brings together the  best minds and names in Erlang programming from language inventors, 
implementers and maintainers. Open source committers, community leaders  and Erlang authors. Everyone who is
anyone will be at the Erlang User Conference 2011!</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>[March 24, 2011] The demo site will go live</b></td></tr></table>
<p>
<table border=0>
 <tr>
  <td><img src="promotion/powered/gif/powered066.gif" border=0></td>
  <td> &nbsp; </td>
  <td>
<p>The site <a href="http://demo.erlang.org">demo.erlang.org</a> will be promoted to
  <a href="http://www.erlang.org">www.erlang.org</a> and hence go live.</p>

<p>There might be some disturbances since we have to change IP addresses through DNS and change mail servers at the same time.</p>

<p>We will also change mailing list software to our previous GNU Mailman; the grass was not greener on the qmail side.
  The web interface to Mailman might take some time to get working, we'll see. All subscribtions will be transferred.</p>

<p>Not all services will be transferred, e.g bittorrent since there has been a fairly low usage.
  Given sufficient public demand, we might rethink this.
  The mirrors will also be a future issue since we now get a dynamic content site.</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>



<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>[March 16, 2011] Erlang/OTP R14B02 has been released</b></td></tr></table>
<p> 
<table border=0>
 <tr>
  <td><img src="promotion/powered/gif/powered066.gif" border=0></td>
  <td> &nbsp; </td>
  <td>
<b>Erlang/OTP R14B02</b> has been released as previously announced.<br/>
<p>See the release notes in the <a href="download/otp_src_R14B02.readme">readme file</a></p>
<p>Download the new release from the <a href="download.html">download page</a>.</p>
<p>
<strong>Highlights:</strong>
</p>
<ul>
<li>
The "halfword" emulator is now official. A 64-bit emulator that uses
less memory than the full 64 bit emulator.
</li>
<li>
EDoc handles Erlang specifications and types.
</li>
<li>
All test suites now run with CommonTest
</li>
</ul>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>[February 23, 2011] Erlang Factory SF Bay Area 2011</b></td></tr></table>
<p> 
<table border=0>
 <tr>
  <td><img src="images/factory.jpg" border=0></td>
  <td> &nbsp; </td>
  <td>
<b>There is less than a week left to book your place at the Erlang Factory SF Bay Area March 21st - 25th 2011 at the Early Bird Rate of $690. The Standard Rate of $900 will apply from March 1st.</b><br/>

<p>The Erlang Factory SF Bay Area 2011 is fast approaching and we are offering you the chance to save over $200 on the cost of standard admission to the conference. To save even more we have also secured a fantastic conference rate on rooms at the Hilton San Francisco Airport Hotel. Both offers are valid until the end of February, so don't miss out and book now!
</p>
<p>
To take full advantage of these savings you can <a href="http://www.erlang-factory.com/conference/SFBay2011">register for the Factory here</a> and 
<a href="http://www.hilton.com/en/hi/groups/personalized/S/SFOAPHF-ERL-20110315/index.jhtml?WT.mc id=POG">book your
hotel room here.</a> 
</p>

<p>2 days of exciting talks and 3 days of expert training will take place from 21st - 25th March 2011 at the  <a href="http://www.erlang-factory.com/conference/SFBay2011/venue">Hilton San Francisco Airport Hotel</a>. Like in previous years the conference is aimed at Erlang enthusiasts from architects to
newbies.</p>

<p>Some of the speakers include <a href="http://www.erlang-factory.com/conference/SFBay2011/speakers/joearmstrong">Joe Armstrong</a> and <a href="http://www.erlang-factory.com/conference/SFBay2011/speakers/RobertVirding">Robert Virding</a> - the inventors of Erlang, <a href="http://www.erlang-factory.com/conference/SFBay2011/speakers/DamienKatz">Damien Katz</a> - the creator of CouchDB, <a href="http://www.erlang-factory.com/conference/SFBay2011/speakers/KostisSagonas">Kostis Sagonas</a> - Leader of the HiPE team at Uppsala University and inventor of Dialyzer,
with a lot more Erlang experts from the US, Europe and the rest of the world yet to be announced.  There will of course be the Erlang University with
courses on, Test Driven Development, Erlang Express, OTP Express and XMPP with Erlang and EjabberD.</p>

<p>For more information go to the <a href="http://www.erlang-factory.com/conference/">website</a>.
  </td> 
 </tr>
</table>

<b>[December 02, 2010] A new Erlang book available!</b></td></tr></table>
<p> 
<table border=0>
 <tr>
  <td><img src="images/logan_cover150.jpg" border=0></td>
  <td> &nbsp; </td>
  <td>
    <b><a href="http://www.manning.com/logan/">Erlang and OTP in Action</a></b> by Martin Logan, Eric Merritt and Richard Carlsson.<br/>
	A book for developers interested in creating practical applications
in Erlang using the OTP framework.
<p>
	Through December 15, 2010 use promotional code erlangorg35 to save 35%
	at <a href="http://www.manning.com/logan/">manning.com</a>.
</p> 
  </td> 
 </tr>
</table>

<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>[October 7, 2010] Erlang/OTP R14B bugfix (for Windows only) is now available for download</b></td></tr></table>
<p> 
<table border=0>
 <tr>
  <td><img src="promotion/powered/gif/powered066.gif" border=0></td>
  <td> &nbsp; </td>
  <td>
<b>Due to reported problems with Erlang/OTP R14B on certain versions of Windows</b>, there is now a new Erlang release for Windows which fixes these problems.<br/>
<p>The self installer as well as a complete source package is available at the <a href="download.html">download page</a>.</p>
  </td> 
 </tr>
</table>

<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>[June 1, 2009] Server upgraded</b></td></tr></table>
<p>
<p>Now the new server is up and running - Webserver, mailserver,
  mailing lists, EEPs with repositories, Bittorrent, etc.
  We have a hard time making Google index the new mailing
  list archives (we have no search engine of our own).
  The Google group
  <a href="http://groups.google.com/group/erlang-programming">
    Erlang Programming</a>
  mirrors the erlang-questions mailing list and has an searchable
  archive as a workaround.
</p>
-->

<!--
<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>[April 21 2009] Erlang/OTP R13B released!</b></td></tr></table>
<p> 

<table border=0>
 <tr>
  <td><img src="promotion/powered/gif/powered066.gif" border=0></td>
  <td> &nbsp; </td>
  <td>
    <b>Erlang/OTP R13B</b> has been released. The R13B chiefly consists
of corrections of bugs in the R13A release. The R13B release is recommended for use in live products.
Some highlights in the R13 releases are:
<ul>
<li>
Significant improvements of SMP and multi-core performance mainly because of multiple run-queues but also a number of other optimizations.
</li>
<li>
Support for Unicode is implemented as described in <a href="http://www.erlang.org/eeps/eep-0010.html">EEP10</a>.
</li>
<li>
New application <b>WxErlang</b>, A binding to the WxWidgets GUI library. In beta status but the intention is that is shall replace GS in a later stage.
</li>
<li>
New application <b>RelTool</b> a release management tool with a graphical frontend for interactive customization of a target system. Still a bit limited
and should be regarded as experimental in this release.   
</li>
<li>Read the <a href="download/otp_src_R13B.readme">readme file for R13B</a> for details.</li>
</ul>
<p>Download the new release from the <a href="download.html">download page</a>.</p>
  </td> 
 </tr>
</table>

<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0

<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>[Nov 5, 2008] Erlang/OTP R12B-5 released</b></td></tr></table>
<p> 
<p>The fifth service release for <b>Erlang/OTP R12B</b> has been released.</p>
<p>Some highlights in this release are:</p>
<ul>
<li>Eunit, an application for unit testing of Erlang modules is now part of the distribution.</li>
<li>User defined attributes can now contain the syntax FuncName/Arity. (An implementation of EEP-24.)</li>
<li>Read the complete list of bug fixes and new functions in the <a href="download/otp_src_R12B-5.readme">readme file</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p>Download the new release from the <a href="download.html">download page</a>.</p>
-->

<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>Erlang/OTP R12B released</b></td></tr></table>
<p> 
<p>The Erlang/OTP team is proud to announce the release of
<b>Erlang/OTP R12B</b>, now with SMP support for Windows and the language 
extensions: bitstring and binary comprehensions.
(Dec 5, 2007)
<p><a href="/doc/highlights.html">Read about more new features in the 
release highlights.
</a>
</p>

<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>Erlang Enhancement Process</b></td></tr></table>
<p>

<p>
The Erlang Enhancement Process is now ready for user comments.
Some polishing is probably still needed. The framework is
running, but there are no actual people subscribed to
the mailing list. At least not during the vacation.
</p>

<p>
During August business will ramp up to normal. 
Follow the link <a href="/eep.html">"Enhancements"</a> to the left
and start working on your EEPs...
</p>
-->
<!--
<p><p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>Erlang/OTP R11B-5 released</b></td></tr></table>
<p>

<p>The fifth and final maintenance release for Erlang/OTP R11B
has been released. (The next release will be the R12B release,
planned to be released before the end of the year.)

<p>The main highlights in this release are the new DocBuilder application
and that the source tar file contains prebuilt Beam and PLT files to speed
up building of the release. For more information,
see the <a href="download/otp_src_R11B-5.readme">README</a> file. (Jun
13, 2007)

<p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0

<table border=0>
 <tr>
  <td><img src="images/jaerlang_small.jpg" border=1></td>
  <td> &nbsp; </td>
  <td>
    <b>Programming Erlang, Software for a Concurrent World</b> by Joe 
    Armstrong is available from Pragmatic Bookshelf.<br>This is the most recent book about Erlang (June 2007) but there are more books on their way.

    <p>For more information, look <a href="http://pragmaticprogrammer.com/titles/jaerlang/index.html">here.</a>

<p><p><table width="100%" bgcolor="#ADD8E6" border=0 cellspacing=0
cellpadding=4><tr><td>
<b>News</b></td></tr></table>
<p>

<ul>

<p><li>July 28, 2004: Tomas Abrahamsson has released a new version (0.92) of the user 
contribution py_interface (minor improvements and bugfixes). The py_interface package is 
acting as an Erlang node written in 100% Python, like the JInterface for Java. It features 
a callback oriented single-threaded programming model.  

<p><li>May 27, 2004: A new version of the <a href="project/test_server">Erlang/OTP Test
Server</a> has been released.

<p><li>Bjarne D&auml;cker has created some nice 
<a href="download-stats/">download statistics graphs</a>.

<p><li>Michael Bradford has contributed
<a href="user.html#smtp_client-1.0">smtp_client-1.0</a>,
a simple SMTP client using gen_fsm behaviour. Supports basic SMTP
&amp; ESMTP commands, including MD5, plain &amp; login authentication.
Also included is email_msg.erl. This very simple module builds a plain
text email suitable for sending via the smtp client.

<p><li>Joakim Grebenö has contributed <a
href="user.html#xmlrpc-1.13">xmlrpc-1.13</a> (updated).  This is an
HTTP 1.1 compliant XML-RPC library for Erlang. It is designed to make
it easy to write XML-RPC Erlang clients and/or servers. The tutorial
is extended and xmlrpc:start_link{1,5,6} now use the generic
behaviors, i.e. can be started as a child to a supervisor.

<p><li>New versions of the <strong>Erlang/OTP Megaco application</strong> 
is released under the <a href="EPLICENSE">Erlang Public License (EPL)</a>.  
Source can be found from the 
<a href="project/megaco/">Megaco home</a>.

<p><li>Cesarini Consulting Ltd, in cooperation with Sj&ouml;land &
Thyselius Telecom AB now offer scheduled Erlang/OTP courses in Sweden,
the UK, the US, and Singapore. For more information click
<a href="http://www.erlang-consulting.com/training_fs.html">here</a>.

</ul>

<a href="old_news.html">Older news.....</a>

-->


    </td>
  </tr>
